org.flemil.ui
Interface Scrollable

All Superinterfaces:
Item
All Known Implementing Classes:
Panel
public interface Scrollable
extends Item

This interface is extended by nay item that can show ScrollBars such that it can contain Items that more than its displayRect both horizontally and vertically. An example of such a Control is a Panel

Author:
Solomon Kariri

Field Detail

DIRECTION_X

static final byte DIRECTION_X
Used to denote scrolling in the x direction. Scrolling can be either positive or negative. This value is passed to an method to tell it that scrolling in the X direction should be accounted for

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DIRECTION_Y

static final byte DIRECTION_Y
Used to denote scrolling in the Y direction. Scrolling can be either positive or negative. This value is passed to an method to tell it that scrolling in the Y direction should be accounted for

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

scrollRectToVisible

void scrollRectToVisible(Rectangle rect,
                         int scrollDirection)
Scrolls the given Rectangle such that its visible or falls within this items displayRect. This method makes sure that the top of the passed in rectangle is visible even though the bottom might not be visible if the passed in rect has a longer height than this Scrollble's displayRect. The remainder can/should be made possible via scrolling.

Parameters:
rect - the Rectangle to be made visible
scrollDirection - the direction in which to scroll. This value can be either Scrollable.DIRECTION_Y for Y scrolling only, Scrollable.DIRECTION_X for X scrolling only or Scrollable.DIRECTION_Y|Scrollable.DIRECTION_X for both Y and X scrolling

isHorScrolling

boolean isHorScrolling()
Tells whether this Scrollable can be or is allowed to do horizontal scrolling

Returns:
true if allowed and false otherwise

setHorScrolling

void setHorScrolling(boolean horScrolling)
Sets whether this Scrollable is allowed to do horizontal scrolling.

Parameters:
horScrolling - to allow horizontal scrolling and false therwise
